name: DRAM memory encryption
description: TME (Intel) or SME (AMD) is used by the hardware on supported SOCs to encrypt all data on external memory buses.
It mitigates against an attacker being able to capture memory data while the system is running or to capture memory by removing a DRAM chip.
This encryption may be activated by either transparently via firmware configuration or by code running in the Linux kernel.
failure-impact: A local attacker can either extract unencrypted content by attaching debug probes on the DIMM modules, or by removing them and inserting them into a computer with a modified DRAM controller.
